00018 void ManusArm::getPosition(float fill[])
00019 {
00020         //get current position
00021         {
00022                 boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00023                 for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
00024                 {
00025                         fill[i] = currState.jointPositions[i];
00026                         //cout << "currState.jointPositions[" << i << "] = " << currState.jointPositions[i] << endl;
00027                 }
00028         }
00029 }

00035 string ManusArm::getCsvState()
00036 {
00037         //Probably shouldn't lock here, as it only reads, and is used for debugging
00038         //boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00039         stringstream sb;
00040         if (currState.isValid)
00041         {
00042                 if (currState.cbox == CBOX_4_JOINT)
00043                 {
00044                         //Units are tenths of a degree
00045                         sb << currState.jointPositions[0] * 0.1 << ",";
00046                         sb << currState.jointPositions[1] * 0.1 << ",";
00047                         sb << currState.jointPositions[2] * 0.1 << ",";
00048                         sb << currState.jointPositions[3] * 0.1 << ",";
00049                         sb << currState.jointPositions[4] * 0.1 << ",";
00050                         sb << currState.jointPositions[5] * 0.1 << ",";
00051                 }
00052                 else
00053                 {
00054                         //Units are 0.022mm
00055                         sb << currState.jointPositions[0] * 0.022 << ",";
00056                         sb << currState.jointPositions[1] * 0.022 << ",";
00057                         sb << currState.jointPositions[2] * 0.022 << ",";
00058                         //Units are tenths of a degree
00059                         sb << currState.jointPositions[3] * 0.1 << ",";
00060                         sb << currState.jointPositions[4] * 0.1 << ",";
00061                         sb << currState.jointPositions[5] * 0.1 << ",";
00062                 }
00063                 //Units are tenths of a millimeter
00064                 sb << currState.jointPositions[6] * 0.1;
00065         }
00066         else
00067         {
00068                 sb << "State not valid yet\n";
00069         }
00070         return sb.str();
00071 }

00077 string ManusArm::getPrintState()
00078 {
00079         //Should not lock here, only reads, useful for debugging as arm moves
00080         //boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00081         stringstream sb;
00082         sb << currState.message + "\n";
00083         if (currState.isValid)
00084         {
00085                 if (currState.cbox == CBOX_4_JOINT)
00086                 {
00087                         //Units are tenths of a degree
00088                         sb << "Axis 1: " << currState.jointPositions[0] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00089                         sb << "Axis 2: " << currState.jointPositions[1] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00090                         sb << "Axis 3: " << currState.jointPositions[2] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00091                         sb << "Axis 4: " << currState.jointPositions[3] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00092                         sb << "Axis 5: " << currState.jointPositions[4] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00093                         sb << "Axis 6: " << currState.jointPositions[5] * 0.1 << " degrees \n";
00094                 }
00095                 else
00096                 {
00097                         //Units are 0.022mm
00098                         sb << "X: " << currState.jointPositions[0] * 0.022 << " mm \n";
00099                         sb << "Y: " << currState.jointPositions[1] * 0.022 << " mm \n";
00100                         sb << "Z: " << currState.jointPositions[2] * 0.022 << " mm \n";
00101                         //Units are tenths of a degree
00102                         sb << "Yaw:   " << currState.jointPositions[3] * 0.1 << " degrees\n";
00103                         sb << "Pitch: " << currState.jointPositions[4] * 0.1 << " degrees\n";
00104                         sb << "Roll:   " << currState.jointPositions[5] * 0.1 << " degrees\n";
00105                 }
00106                 //Units are tenths of a millimeter
00107                 sb << "Gripper: " << currState.jointPositions[6] * 0.1 << " mm \n";
00108         }
00109         else
00110         {
00111                 sb << "State not valid yet\n";
00112         }
00113 
00114         return sb.str();
00115 }
00116 
00122 void ManusArm::setCbox(int cbox, can_frame* frm)
00123 {
00124         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00125         currState.cbox = cbox;
00126         frm->can_id = currState.cbox;
00127 }
00128 
00129 /* Units are as follows
00130  * X, Y, Z are 0.022 mm every 20 ms, (1.1mm/sec) with a possible delay of 60ms on the first motion
00131  * So to move at 1 cm / second, you need to request a speed of 9 (9.9mm/sec) or 10 (11mm/sec),
00132  * depending on whether you want to be too fast or too slow. The valid range is 0-127.
00133  *
00134  * Roll, pitch, and yaw all refer to the gripper, and are in 0.1 degree per increments.
00135  * The valid range is 0-10 (0-1 degree/20msec)
00136  *
00137  * Gripper is opening and closing rates in units of 0.1mm/20msec.
00138  * The valid range is 0 to 15
00139  *
00140  *  We don't have a lift unit. The valid values are -1 (up), 0 (off), and 1 (down)
00141  */
00142 
00150 void ManusArm::moveCartesian(const CartesianMove& cmd)
00151 {
00152         motionThread = boost::thread(boost::bind(&ManusArm::doCartesianMove, this, cmd));
00153 }
00154 
00162 void ManusArm::doCartesianMove(const CartesianMove& cmd)
00163 {
00164         // A lot of the logic here is from can_comm.cpp's function pd_control()
00165         // Generally speaking, it works by:
00166         // 1. Calculating the difference between the current position and the desired position (the error)
00167         // 2. Multiplying the error by a speed constant
00168         // 3. Checking that the speeds are within limits
00169         // 4. Sending the speeds to the arm
00170         // Steps 1 and 2 ensure that the arm slows as it approaches the desired position
00171 
00172         // Speed constants for arm
00173         const float Kp[CART_MV_ARR_SZ] = { 5, 5, 5, 0.8, 0.7, 0.6, 0.5 };
00174 
00175         // Which speed limits to use. 4 is full, kate's work used 2 when approaching user
00176 
00177 
00178         // Error in position
00179         float pos_err[CART_MV_ARR_SZ];
00180         // Previous position
00181         float prev_pos[CART_MV_ARR_SZ];
00182         // New speeds
00183         float new_speeds[CART_MV_ARR_SZ];
00184 
00185         for (int i = 0; i < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; i++)
00186         {
00187                 pos_err[i] = 0.0f;
00188                 prev_pos[i] = 0.0f;
00189                 new_speeds[i] = 0.0f;
00190         }
00191 
00192         bool moving = true;
00193 
00194         while (moving && !moveComplete)
00195         {
00196                 // Get current position
00197                 {
00198                         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00199                         for (int i = 0; i < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; i++)
00200                                 prev_pos[i] = currState.jointPositions[i];
00201                 }
00202 
00203                 // Calculate the error and speeds
00204                 register float tmp1, tmp2;
00205                 for (int i = X; i <= Z; i++) // Currently only calculates for X, Y, Z
00206                 {
00207                         if (i == ROLL) // roll -180 ~ 180 : linear scaling
00208                         {
00209                                 {
00210                                         tmp1 = (180.0f - cmd.positions[i]) - (180.0f - prev_pos[i]);
00211                                 }
00212 
00213                                 if (tmp1 >= 0.0f)
00214                                         if (tmp1 <= 180.0f)
00215                                                 tmp2 = tmp1;
00216                                         else
00217                                                 tmp2 = tmp1 - 360.0f;
00218                                 else if (tmp1 > -180.0f)
00219                                         tmp2 = tmp1;
00220                                 else
00221                                         tmp2 = 360.0f + tmp1;
00222 
00223                                 pos_err[i] = tmp2;
00224                         }
00225                         else
00226                                 pos_err[i] = cmd.positions[i] - (prev_pos[i]);
00227 
00228                         float control_input = Kp[i] * pos_err[i];
00229 
00230                         new_speeds[i] = fabs(control_input) > SPEED_LIMITS[i][cmd.speeds[i]] ?
00231                                                 sign(control_input) * SPEED_LIMITS[i][cmd.speeds[i]] :
00232                                                 control_input;
00233                 }
00234 #ifdef DEBUG
00235                 cout << "Target Position: ";
00236                 for (int ii = 0; ii < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; ii++)
00237                 {
00238                         cout << cmd.positions[ii] << ", ";
00239                 }
00240                 cout << endl;
00241 
00242                 cout << "Position: ";
00243                 for (int ii = 0; ii < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; ii++)
00244                 {
00245                         cout << prev_pos[ii] << ", ";
00246                 }
00247                 cout << endl;
00248                 cout << "Error: ";
00249                 for (int ii = 0; ii < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; ii++)
00250                 {
00251                         cout << pos_err[ii] << ", ";
00252                 }
00253                 cout << endl;
00254                 cout << "New speeds: ";
00255                 for (int ii = 0; ii < CART_MV_ARR_SZ; ii++)
00256                 {
00257                         cout << new_speeds[ii] << ", ";
00258                 }
00259                 cout << endl << endl;
00260 #endif
00261 
00262                 // The struct can_frame uses a different order for axes of movement:
00263                 //              lift:   0 (LIFT-7)
00264                 //              x:      1 (X+1)
00265                 //              y:              2 (Y+1)
00266                 //              z:              3 (Z+1)
00267                 //              yaw:    4 (YAW+1)
00268                 //              pitch:  5 (PITCH+1)
00269                 //              roll:   6 (ROLL+1)
00270                 //              grip:   7 (GRIP+1)
00271 
00272                 struct can_frame move;
00273                 setCbox(CBOX_1_CARTESIAN, &move);
00274                 move.can_dlc = FRM_ARR_SZ;
00275                 move.data[LIFT-7] = 0; // Lift unit is not used in Cartesian moves
00276                 move.data[X+1] = new_speeds[X];
00277                 move.data[Y+1] = new_speeds[Y];
00278                 move.data[Z+1] = new_speeds[Z];
00279                 move.data[YAW+1] = 0; // Yaw movement not yet implemented
00280                 move.data[PITCH+1] = 0; // Pitch movement not yet implemented
00281                 move.data[ROLL+1] = 0; // Roll movement not yet implemented
00282                 move.data[GRIP+1] = 0; // Grip movement not yet implemented
00283 
00284                 enqueueFrame(move);
00285 
00286                 // Wait 60 msec
00287                 boost::this_thread::sleep(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(60));
00288 
00289                 // Assume we are done
00290                 moving = false;
00291 
00292                 for (int ii = X; ii <= Z; ii++) // Currently only calculates for X, Y, Z
00293                 {
00294                         if (fabs(pos_err[ii]) > CARTESIAN_SLOP)
00295                         {
00296                                 moving = true;
00297                                 break;
00298                         }
00299                 }
00300         }
00301 
00302         //Stop the arm, otherwise it continues with whatever speeds it had when the move was done
00303         struct can_frame move;
00304         setCbox(CBOX_1_CARTESIAN, &move);
00305         move.can_dlc = FRM_ARR_SZ;
00306         for (int i = 0; i < FRM_ARR_SZ; i++)
00307                 move.data[i] = 0;
00308         enqueueFrame(move);
00309 
00310         // Wait 60 msec
00311         boost::this_thread::sleep(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(60));
00312 
00313         {
00314                 boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00315                 moveComplete = true;
00316         }
00317 }

00326 void ManusArm::moveConstant(const ConstantMove& cmd)
00327 {
00328     motionThread = boost::thread(boost::bind(&ManusArm::doConstantMove, this, cmd));
00329 }
00330 
00338 void ManusArm::doConstantMove(const ConstantMove& cmd)
00339 {
00340         // The struct can_frame uses a different order for axes of movement:
00341         //              lift:   0 (LIFT-7)
00342         //              x:      1 (X+1)
00343         //              y:              2 (Y+1)
00344         //              z:              3 (Z+1)
00345         //              yaw:    4 (YAW+1)
00346         //              pitch:  5 (PITCH+1)
00347         //              roll:   6 (ROLL+1)
00348         //              grip:   7 (GRIP+1)
00349 
00350     // Enqueue the movement frame
00351     struct can_frame move;
00352         setCbox(CBOX_1_CARTESIAN, &move);
00353         move.can_dlc = FRM_ARR_SZ;
00354         move.data[LIFT-7] = cmd.states[LIFT];
00355         for (int i = X; i <= GRIP; i++)
00356                 move.data[i+1] = SPEED_LIMITS[i][cmd.speeds[i]] * cmd.states[i];
00357         enqueueFrame(move);
00358 
00359         // Wait 60 msec
00360         boost::this_thread::sleep(boost::posix_time::milliseconds(60));
00361 }
00362 
00366 void ManusArm::setCartesian()
00367 {
00368         struct can_frame frm;
00369         //Transition to Cartesian mode
00370         setCbox(CBOX_1_CARTESIAN, &frm);
00371         frm.can_dlc = 8;
00372         //Zero all motion rates
00373         for (int ii = 0; ii < frm.can_dlc; ii++)
00374         {
00375                 frm.data[ii] = 0;
00376         }
00377         enqueueFrame(frm);
00378 }
00379 
00386 void ManusArm::fold()
00387 {
00388         struct can_frame frm;
00389         setCbox(CBOX_6_FOLD, &frm);
00390         frm.can_dlc = 0;
00391         //Send twice to trigger folding
00392         enqueueFrame(frm);
00393         enqueueFrame(frm);
00394 }
00395 
00399 void ManusArm::unfold()
00400 {
00401         struct can_frame frm;
00402         setCbox(CBOX_5_UNFOLD, &frm);
00403         frm.can_dlc = 0;
00404         //Should I zero the data here?
00405         //send twice to trigger unfolding
00406         enqueueFrame(frm);
00407         enqueueFrame(frm);
00408 }
00409 
00414 void ManusArm::enqueueFrame(can_frame toSend)
00415 {
00416         if (!sendQueue.empty())
00417         {
00418                 can_frame prevFrame = *(sendQueue.end() - 1);
00419                 //Check if this message and the last message queued are the same type
00420                 if (toSend.can_id == prevFrame.can_id)
00421                 {
00422                         /* If it is a motion packet, check if the data is the same. Otherwise,
00423                          * it is a fold out/fold in packet, and so can be repeated
00424                          */
00425                         if (toSend.can_id == CBOX_1_CARTESIAN || toSend.can_id == CBOX_4_JOINT)
00426                         {
00427                                 bool dataMatch = true;
00428                                 for (int ii = 0; ii < 6; ii++)
00429                                 {
00430                                         if (toSend.data[ii] != prevFrame.data[ii])
00431                                         {
00432                                                 dataMatch = false;
00433                                                 break;
00434                                         }
00435                                 }
00436                                 //All the data were the same, don't resend the packet
00437                                 if (dataMatch)
00438                                 {
00439                                         return;
00440                                 }
00441                         }
00442                 }
00443         }
00444         //None of the previous checks blocked the packet, add it to the queue
00445         sendQueue.insert(sendQueue.begin(), toSend);
00446 }
00447 
00451 void ManusArm::pollCanSocket()
00452 {
00453         struct can_frame frame;
00454         while (running)
00455         {
00456                 /* Read a message back from the CAN bus */
00457                 uint bytes_read = recv(canSock, &frame, sizeof(struct can_frame), 0);
00458 
00459                 if (bytes_read < sizeof(struct can_frame))
00460                 {
00461                         cerr << "Read: incomplete CAN frame" << endl;
00462                 }
00463 
00464                 //              printf("ID: %x \n", frame.can_id);
00465                 //              printf("Length: %i \n", frame.can_dlc);
00466                 //              for (int ii = 0; ii < frame.can_dlc; ii++)
00467                 //              {
00468                 //                      printf("Data %x\n", frame.data[ii]);
00469                 //              }
00470 
00471                 //TODO copy the data out into a data structure in the ARM class
00472                 if (frame.can_id == 0x350)
00473                 { //Status bytes (2 bytes) and axis 1-3 (6 bytes)
00474                         //Lock to modify state
00475                         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00476 
00477                         //Update joint positions
00478                         currState.jointPositions[0] = ((int8_t) frame.data[2] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[3]; //X
00479                         currState.jointPositions[1] = ((int8_t) frame.data[4] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[5]; //Y
00480                         currState.jointPositions[2] = ((int8_t) frame.data[6] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[7]; //Z
00481 
00482                         currState.message = "STATUS: Updated position(1): " + toString<canid_t> (frame.can_id, hex);
00483 
00484                         //Deal with status bytes
00485                         uint8_t status = frame.data[0];
00486                         uint8_t mesg = frame.data[1];
00487                         switch (status)
00488                         {
00489                         case STAT_NONE:
00490                                 //Do Nothing
00491                                 break;
00492                         case STAT_WARNING:
00493                                 switch (mesg)
00494                                 {
00495                                 case MSG_GRIPPER_STUCK:
00496                                         currState.message = "WARNING: Gripper is stuck";
00497                                         break;
00498                                 case MSG_WRONG_AREA:
00499                                         currState.message = "WARNING: Wrong area";
00500                                         break;
00501                                 case MSG_ARM_FOLDED_STRETCHED:
00502                                         currState.message = "WARNING: ARM maximum folding or extension reached";
00503                                         break;
00504                                 case MSG_BLOCKED_MOTOR:
00505                                         currState.message = "WARNING: Motor blocked or weight limit exceeded";
00506                                         break;
00507                                 case MSG_MAX_ROT:
00508                                         currState.message = "WARNING: Maximum rotation of base motor";
00509                                         break;
00510                                 default:
00511                                         currState.message = "WARNING: Nonsense message byte: %x\n" + toString<uint8_t> (status, hex);
00512                                         break;
00513                                 }
00514                                 break;
00515                         case STAT_GENERAL:
00516                                 switch (mesg)
00517                                 {
00518                                 case MSG_FOLDED:
00519                                         currState.message = "GENERAL_MESSAGE: ARM folding complete";
00520                                         break;
00521                                 case MSG_UNFOLDED:
00522                                         currState.message = "GENERAL_MESSAGE: ARM unfolding complete";
00523                                         break;
00524                                 case MSG_GRIPPER_INIT:
00525                                         currState.message = "GENERAL_MESSAGE: Gripper ready";
00526                                         break;
00527                                 case MSG_ABS_MEASURE:
00528                                         currState.message = "GENERAL_MESSAGE: Absolute measuring ready";
00529                                         break;
00530                                 default:
00531                                         currState.message = "GENERAL_MESSAGE: Nonsense message byte: %x\n" + toString<uint8_t> (status, hex);
00532                                         break;
00533                                 }
00534                                 //cout << currState.message << endl;
00535                                 break;
00536                         case STAT_ERROR:
00537                                 switch (mesg)
00538                                 {
00539                                 case MSG_IO_80C552:
00540                                         currState.message = "ERROR: CAN I/O processor";
00541                                         break;
00542                                 case MSG_ABS_ENCODER:
00543                                         currState.message = "ERROR: Absolute encoder";
00544                                         break;
00545                                 case MSG_MOVE_WITHOUT_INPUT:
00546                                         currState.message = "ERROR: Move without input";
00547                                         break;
00548                                 default:
00549                                         currState.message = "ERROR: Nonsense message byte: " + toString<uint8_t> (status, hex);
00550                                         break;
00551                                 }
00552                                 break;
00553                         default:
00554                                 currState.message = "STATUS: Nonsense status byte: %x\n" + toString<uint8_t> (status, hex);
00555                                 break;
00556                         }
00557                 }
00558                 else if (frame.can_id == 0x360)
00559                 { //Axis 4-7 (8 bytes)
00560                         //Lock to update state
00561                         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00562                         //Update joint positions
00563                         currState.jointPositions[3] = ((int8_t) frame.data[0] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[1]; //Yaw
00564                         currState.jointPositions[4] = ((int8_t) frame.data[2] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[3]; //Pitch
00565                         currState.jointPositions[5] = ((int8_t) frame.data[4] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[5]; //Roll
00566                         currState.jointPositions[6] = ((int8_t) frame.data[6] << 8) + (uint8_t) frame.data[7]; //Gripper
00567                         currState.message = "STATUS: Updated position(2): " + toString<canid_t> (frame.can_id, hex);
00568                         //The state has been updated and is now valid
00569                         if (currState.cbox == CBOX_1_CARTESIAN || currState.cbox == CBOX_4_JOINT)
00570                         {
00571                                 currState.isValid = true;
00572                         }
00573                 }
00574                 else if (frame.can_id == 0x37F)
00575                 { //Go to send reply
00576                         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00577                         currState.message = "STATUS: Ready for reply: " + toString<canid_t> (frame.can_id, hex);
00578                         //if there is a reply ready, send it
00579                         if (!sendQueue.empty())
00580                         {
00581                                 //filled from front, sent from back
00582                                 can_frame frame = sendQueue.back();
00583                                 uint bytes_sent = write(canSock, &frame, sizeof(frame));
00584                                 if (bytes_sent < sizeof(struct can_frame))
00585                                 {
00586                                         throw ArmException((char*) "Failed to write CAN frame to arm:" + errno);
00587                                 }
00588                                 sendQueue.pop_back();
00589                         };
00590                 }
00591                 else
00592                 {
00593                         boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00594                         currState.message = "WARNING: Nonsense ID value: " + toString<canid_t> (frame.can_id, hex);
00595                 }
00596         }
00597 }
00598 
00606 ManusArm* ManusArm::instance()
00607 {
00608         if (!armInstance)
00609         {
00610                 armInstance = new ManusArm;
00611         }
00612         return armInstance;
00613 }
00614 
00620 int ManusArm::init(string interface)
00621 {
00622         moveComplete = false;
00623 
00624         /* Create the socket */
00625         canSock = socket(PF_CAN, SOCK_RAW, CAN_RAW);
00626         if (canSock < 0)
00627         {
00628                 throw ArmException((char*) "Failed to open socket:" + errno);
00629         }
00630 
00631         /* Locate the interface you wish to use */
00632         struct ifreq ifr;
00633         strcpy(ifr.ifr_name, interface.c_str());
00634         /* ifr.ifr_ifindex gets filled with that device's index */
00635         if (ioctl(canSock, SIOCGIFINDEX, &ifr) < 0)
00636         {
00637                 throw ArmException((char*) "Ioctl failed:" + errno);
00638         }
00639 
00640         /* Select that CAN interface, and bind the socket to it. */
00641         struct sockaddr_can addr;
00642         addr.can_family = AF_CAN;
00643         addr.can_ifindex = ifr.ifr_ifindex;
00644         if (bind(canSock, (struct sockaddr*) &addr, sizeof(addr)) < 0)
00645         {
00646                 throw ArmException((char*) "Bind failed:" + errno);
00647         }
00648 
00649         /* Send a message three times, wasting time
00650          *  to get valid position data.
00651          */
00652         struct can_frame frame;
00653         for (int ii = 0; ii < 4; ii++)
00654         {
00655                 //Set the mode to cartesian
00656                 setCartesian();
00657 
00658                 //Send the mode setting CAN message
00659                 while (1)
00660                 {
00661                         /* Read a message back from the CAN bus */
00662                         uint bytes_read = recv(canSock, &frame, sizeof(struct can_frame), 0);
00663 
00664                         if (bytes_read < sizeof(struct can_frame))
00665                         {
00666                                 cerr << "Read: incomplete CAN frame" << endl;
00667                         }
00668 
00669                         if (frame.can_id == 0x37F)
00670                         { //Go to send reply
00671                                 boost::mutex::scoped_lock lock(stateMutex);
00672                                 currState.message = "STATUS: Ready for reply: " + toString<canid_t> (frame.can_id, hex);
00673                                 //if there is a reply ready, send it
00674                                 if (!sendQueue.empty())
00675                                 {
00676                                         //filled from front, sent from back
00677                                         can_frame frame = sendQueue.back();
00678                                         uint bytes_sent = write(canSock, &frame, sizeof(frame));
00679                                         if (bytes_sent < sizeof(struct can_frame))
00680                                         {
00681                                                 throw ArmException((char*) "Failed to write CAN frame to arm:" + errno);
00682                                         }
00683                                         sendQueue.pop_back();
00684                                 }
00685                                 else
00686                                 {
00687                                         /* We have sent the message and received the 0x37F reply after it,
00688                                          * which means we are now in cartesian mode and tthe position data
00689                                          * will mean something. Otherwise, the position data is not well-defined,
00690                                          * and causes problems.
00691                                          */
00692                                         break;
00693                                 }
00694                         }
00695                 }
00696         }
00697 
00698         //Start the main CAN communication loop
00699         running = true;
00700         boost::thread doPoll(boost::bind(&ManusArm::pollCanSocket, this));
00701 
00702         //Wait for the main loop to update the state
00703         while (!currState.isValid)
00704         {
00705                 sleep(1);
00706                 //wait 120 msec
00707                 //              timespec delay;
00708                 //              timespec remaining;
00709                 //              delay.tv_sec = 0;
00710                 //              delay.tv_nsec = 120000000;
00711                 //              nanosleep(&delay, &remaining);
00712         }
00713         cout << "ARM init done" << endl;
00714         return 0;
00715 }
00716 
00720 ManusArm::ManusArm()
00721 {
00722         //Not valid until the polling thread updates the state
00723         currState.isValid = false;
00724 }
00725 
00729 ArmException::ArmException(char* message) throw ()
00730 {
00731         msg = (char*) malloc(strlen(message));
00732         if (msg != NULL)
00733         {
00734                 strncpy(msg, message, strlen(message));
00735         }
00736 }
00737 
00741 const char* ArmException::what() const throw ()
00742 {
00743         return msg;
00744 }
